image.altText: Primary school in the ACT generic

props.synopsis: Two schools are completely closed, and another eight have partial closures as the clean-up of coloured sand products continues.

title.children: Ten schools to remain at least partially closed in the ACT

image.altText: A drawing using coloured sand.

props.synopsis: A Canberra mother who used coloured sand to celebrate Diwali in her backyard wants more help from WorkSafe ACT after being advised to cordon off the area, a thoroughfare to her home, and call an asbestos company.

title.children: Woman told to cordon off backyard, access to house, after using coloured sand

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal family members.

props.synopsis: The family of a 17-year-old Indigenous boy say he was racially profiled when he was pulled from a Canberra bus by police officers who handcuffed him before realising he was the wrong person.

title.children: Aboriginal teen mistakenly pulled from bus at gunpoint after 'racial profiling'

image.altText: A smiling man fixing a bicycle

props.synopsis: Harri Jokinen is one of several people who died from accidents during pursuits involving NSW Police.

title.children: 'I was killed too': Police pursuit death wrecks ACT family

image.altText: The father of the victim standing outside court.

props.synopsis: A court prepares to sentence a speeding, drug-affected driver who was on the wrong side of the road before a fatal crash.

title.children: Tom says he felt his son's death was mocked as court prepares to sentence woman

image.altText: ACT Ambulance Service

props.synopsis: An internal review has revealed the service needs at least 80 additional ambulance officers, response times are worsening, and night shifts are failing to meet minimum staffing levels 96 per cent of the time.

title.children: ACT ambulance officer shortages could be 'difference between life and death'

image.altText: Alicia Jauregui

props.synopsis: A P-plater in an uninsured, unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle hit and killed a cyclist last year. Today, he was jailed.

title.children: P-plater in unregistered and unroadworthy vehicle jailed over fatal crash

image.altText: ACT Australian of the Year Rose McGready.

props.synopsis: Rose McGready has been living in a refugee camp for more than 30 years, having dedicated her life to saving the lives of vulnerable women and children.

title.children: Dr McGready honoured for 30 years spent working with mums in Myanmar

image.altText: Ben Stokes shakes hands with Steve Smith before the first Ashes Test.

props.synopsis: Australia names two fresh faces as the famous Test series against England kicks off at Perth Stadium. Follow live.

title.children: Ashes finally arrive as new-look Aussies take on English Bazballers

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: Critical minerals are in every room of your home. Let's take a tour

image.altText: Green, pink, blue and multi-coloured sand products in transparent, white tubs on a white background.

props.synopsis: The online retail platform eBay Australia tells the ABC it uses artificial intelligence to stay informed of product recalls and to flag items that may be subject to a notice so they can be removed.

title.children: Coloured sand for sale on eBay removed days after asbestos recall

image.altText: A Virgin plane is seen through an airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia and Qantas will ban the use of portable power banks from next month following a string of international incidents.

title.children: Virgin and Qantas to ban portable power banks after string of fires

image.altText: A white woman in a black linen vest and pants, walking out of a building, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Building company director Jessica Buckley is the fourth person charged with fraud over an alleged $71 million Department of Defence contracts scandal.

title.children: Fourth person charged over alleged $71m Defence contracts fraud

image.altText: A space station in orbit over a cloudy day on Earth.

props.synopsis: Moss has the potential to provide food for astronauts of the future, according to a study that exposed one of Earth's oldest plants to the extremes of space travel.

title.children: Moss survived nine months in space outside the ISS before returning to Earth

image.altText: neo-nazis rally outside nsw parliament

props.synopsis: While federal and state governments, police and national security agencies grapple with how to respond to the National Socialist Network, several financial institutions and service providers have acted independently to restrict the flow of funds to the white supremacy group.

title.children: The high price of hate: Neo-Nazi figure's funds frozen, fundraising blocked

image.altText: A worker installs electricity transmission components on an electricity pylon in Chuzhou.

props.synopsis: Countries across the globe are racing to rewire their electricity systems for a decarbonised future. In Australia, delays are mounting, along with doubts about whether it can meet goals on schedule.

title.children: Australia may just be one step ahead in the global race to rewire the world

image.altText: Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has accused Chris Bowen of being a "part-time energy minister" after he stuck a deal to take up a negotiator role for COP31. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition accuses Chris Bowen of being a 'part-time energy minister'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Twitch added to social media ban
Sussan Ley says Bowen is a 'globetrotting' and 'part-time energy minister'
Hawke says Liberal party has 'brand issues' after resignation of NSW Liberal leader

image.altText: A doctor wearing a white coat and a stethoscope writes on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A Perth doctor is suspended after disclosing confidential medical information about a patient and her baby to her estranged husband, despite knowing there was a domestic violence restraining order against him.

title.children: Woman's medical records given to ex-partner despite domestic violence order

image.altText: A greater glider on a branch at nighttime

props.synopsis: New data points to the "systemic" under-reporting of greater glider dens within areas earmarked for logging in NSW, which scientists say could result in localised extinctions.

title.children: 'Absolute madness': Environment groups decry glider survey results

image.altText: Purple pineapples in a box with their crowns still intact on the top.

props.synopsis: Striking new purple-skinned pineapples are being trialled in Queensland, but the wait to taste them could last 10 years.

title.children: Grower trials purple-skinned pineapple varieties in Queensland

image.altText: A group of women celebrate after an AFLW goal.

props.synopsis: Melbourne was pushed to its limit during a horror 2024 season but the pain gleamed from that difficult campaign has formed the basis of its return for another preliminary final.

title.children: Why the hard times were the making of Melbourne's AFLW premiership charge

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter celebrates a goal for Chelsea against Barcelona.

props.synopsis: In a player-of-the-match performance, Ellie Carpenter sends Chelsea fans into a frenzy with a brilliant goal against European heavyweights Barcelona.

title.children: Matildas star Carpenter scores stunner in Chelsea's draw with Barcelona

image.altText: A woman with brown shoulder-length hair sits looking away from the camera with people sitting behind her

props.synopsis: Former mayor Alice Guo has generated headlines for years in the Philippines. Now, her story might have come to an end.

title.children: Philippines mayor sentenced to life in prison for human trafficking

image.altText: Marm Fowler warming up for a Matildas match in 2025.

props.synopsis: Montpellier responds to racism allegations made by Matildas forward Mary Fowler, who says a teammate gave her bananas as a departing gift in 2022.

title.children: French football club denies Fowler's racism allegation

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks at Chris Bowen while they sit in parliament.

props.synopsis: Türkiye is the big winner in the diplomatic stand-off over COP31, but nabbing the most powerful seat at the table while someone else picks up the lunch tab is not a bad result.

title.children: Türkiye may have won the big prize, but Australia got a Goldilocks solution

image.altText: People use fire extinguishers to put out a fire at COP30

props.synopsis: Officials say the fire, which erupted at one of the country exhibition pavilions, was brought under control in six minutes as security personnel ordered thousands of delegates in the sprawling building to go outside.

title.children: Thirteen people treated for smoke inhalation after fire at COP30 venue

image.altText: A plastic tub with a first aid kit and tinned food inside

props.synopsis: I sat down with my family to make an emergency kit and an emergency plan. Here's how we did it and what we spent.

title.children: One evening's planning has made me feel more prepared for an emergency

image.altText: A drone explodes during a Russian missile and drone strike in kyiv

props.synopsis: European allies of Kyiv say "peace cannot be capitulation" as details of a new plan to end the Ukraine war emerge.

title.children: 'Capitulation': Everything we know about new US plans to end war in Ukraine

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskiy welcomes a top us army official, they are shaking hands

props.synopsis: The White House says senior Trump administration officials have met Ukrainian officials in the past week to discuss the plan.

title.children: Zelenskyy ready to work on US-backed plan to end war in Ukraine

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths

image.altText: bass guitarist gary mounfield screams while on stage in a purple shirt

props.synopsis: Mounfield was a member of the classic Stone Roses line-up for their 1989 self-titled debut album, which featured hits such as I Wanna Be Adored, She Bangs The Drums, and I Am The Resurrection.

title.children: Former Stone Roses bassist Gary 'Mani' Mounfield dies aged 63

image.altText: graphic representation of children holding hands and toys

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the state's "broken" child protection system hears from staff who work at the child safety department.

title.children: Application to remove 66 newborns made in one region in 4 years, inquiry reveals

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Six Democratic politicians, all of whom are veterans, are urging members of the military not to obey unlawful orders.

title.children: Trump floats death penalty for Democrats urging military to refuse illegal orders

image.altText: Close up of hemp leaves

props.synopsis: A trial showing industrial hemp can be grown year-round has farmers excited about the crop's "huge" potential.

title.children: Winter trial could be key to unlocking 'huge' industrial hemp industry

image.altText: Six men in military uniform carry a casket draped in the US flag.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden, George Bush and every living former vice-president — Kamala Harris, Mike Pence, Al Gore and Dan Quayle — were in attendance, along with generals, foreign dignitaries and Supreme Court justices.

title.children: US elite gathers for Dick Cheney's funeral but Trump and Vance not invited
